meanings.definition: To have been cheated or swindled.
meanings.sent1: She felt skinked when she realized the product she bought was fake.
meanings.sent2: He skinked me out of my money with his dishonest scheme.
meanings.sent3: The tricky salesman skinked her into buying a broken watch.
meanings.sent4: Being skinked by that con artist left a bitter taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of being skinked lingered long after the scam was uncovered.

meanings.definition: To have been intoxicated or drunk.
meanings.sent1: After a few too many drinks, he was completely skinked.
meanings.sent2: She skinked herself with the strong cocktails at the party.
meanings.sent3: The skinked party guests danced wildly under the disco ball.
meanings.sent4: The night air felt like a skinked embrace as they stumbled home.
meanings.sent5: The room spun around her as she realized how skinked she was.
